member.name: T:BlueQuark.Internal.ABasePresenter`2
member.summary: A Base presenter class is a Presenter class with a dedicated metric test suite. It also can use the Require/Release system.

member.name: P:BlueQuark.Internal.ABasePresenter`2.IsRequired
member.summary: Gets the required state of the current component (this). True if at least one external component is using this.

member.name: M:BlueQuark.Internal.ABasePresenter`2.Require(System.Object)
member.summary: Sets a flag that the current component (this) is used by the calling component (owner). An app can require a component only one time. Multiple components in OS can require a same component. MUST be call from Impl side.

member.name: M:BlueQuark.Internal.ABasePresenter`2.Release
member.summary: Free the current component (this) by the calling component. MUST be call from Impl side.

member.name: M:BlueQuark.Internal.ABasePresenter`2.ForceRelease
member.summary: Free all 'require' flags

member.name: P:BlueQuark.Internal.ABasePresenter`2.TaskOwners
member.summary: Gets all components that are currently using this component

member.name: M:BlueQuark.Internal.ABasePresenter`2.RunTests
member.summary: Run the test suite of the component.

member.name: M:BlueQuark.Internal.ABasePresenter`2.RunMetric
member.summary: Run the metric suite of the component class.

member.name: T:BlueQuark.Internal.APresenter`1
member.summary: A presenter class is linked to a Unity MonoBehaviour (called ULink). ULink are not directly accessible and must be managed by the presenter.

member.summary: Unity link (MonoBehaviour) of the Presenter object. Use it for platform dependant purposes and/or display and/or Unity callbacks

member.name: M:BlueQuark.Internal.APresenter`1.GetComponentInChildren``1
member.summary: Returns the Unity component of Type type in the GameObject or any of its children using depth first search. An Unity component is returned only if it is found on an active GameObject.
member.typeparam: The type of the Unity component to retrieve
member.returns: A Unity component of the matching type, if found.

member.name: M:BlueQuark.Internal.APresenter`1.GetComponentInParent``1
member.summary: Returns the component of Type type in the GameObject or any of its parents. Recurses upwards until it finds a valid component.Returns null if no component found. Only components on active GameObjects are returned.
member.typeparam: The type of the Unity component to retrieve
member.returns: A Unity component of the matching type, if found.

member.name: M:BlueQuark.Internal.APresenter`1.GetComponent``1
member.summary: Returns the Unity component of Type type if the game object has one attached, null if it doesn't.
member.typeparam: The type of Unity component to retrieve.
member.returns: A Unity component of the matching type, if found.

member.name: M:BlueQuark.Internal.APresenter`1.GetComponents``1
member.summary: Returns Unity components of Type type if the game object has one attached, null if it doesn't.
member.typeparam: The type of Unity component to retrieve.
member.returns: A Unity component of the matching type, if found.

member.name: M:BlueQuark.Internal.APresenter`1.AddComponent``1
member.summary: Adds a Unity component class corresponding to the requested type to the game object.
member.typeparam: The type of the Unity component to add

member.summary: All the possible audio events that can be detected by Vocon.

member.name: F:BlueQuark.Internal.VoConEvent.BEGINNING_OF_SPEECH
member.summary: User started to speak.

member.name: F:BlueQuark.Internal.VoConEvent.MAYBE_SPEECH
member.summary: Could be the beginning of speech.

member.name: F:BlueQuark.Internal.VoConEvent.NO_SPEECH
member.summary: The previously sent MAYBE_SPEECH event did not lead to and actual beginning of speech.

member.name: F:BlueQuark.Internal.VoConEvent.TIMEOUT
member.summary: A timeout occured.

member.name: F:BlueQuark.Internal.VoConEvent.TRAILING_SILENCE
member.summary: A trailing silence was detected.

member.name: F:BlueQuark.Internal.VoConEvent.BAD_SIGNAL_NOISE_RATIO
member.summary: The signal to noise ratio is too low. This event is generated if at the end of an utterance the signal/noise ratio remains below 12dB.

member.name: F:BlueQuark.Internal.VoConEvent.OVERLOAD
member.summary: The speech level is too loud.

member.name: F:BlueQuark.Internal.VoConEvent.TOO_QUIET
member.summary: The speech level is too weak.

member.name: F:BlueQuark.Internal.VoConEvent.NO_SIGNAL
member.summary: No or very low input signal.

member.name: F:BlueQuark.Internal.VoConEvent.POOR_MIC
member.summary: This could mean that the microphone or the audio hardware is of poor quality.

member.name: F:BlueQuark.Internal.VoConEvent.NO_LEADING_SILENCE
member.summary: The recording apparantly does not start with leading silence. Possibly the speaker started speaking too soon, but because this detection is only energy based, other noise events at the start of the utterance may also trigger this condition.

member.summary: The confidence level of the result. Values are between 1 (low confidence) and 9999 (high confidence).

member.summary: The text of the result from the recognition process.

Sets robot linear (meters / s) and angular (deg / s) velocities.
Rate of change (in meters by second) of an object position with in a certain time rangeArticle Rate (in degrees by second) at which it rotates around a chosen center point: that is, the time rate of change of its angular displacement relative to the originArticle > >

members.member:
Queue the wished toast parameter. It will displayed as soon as possible after any previous queued toasts or slides. Built in toast can be set by using the method With(args) like this : Display().With(toast_args). Toasts are displayed until Toaster.Hide() is called.
Type of toast The toast info to argument with the method With(args) >

member.summary: Hide the displayed toast

member.name: M:BlueQuark.Utils.Hysteresis(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Computes the hysteresis value (delay effect).
member.remarks: Hysteresis is the time-based dependence of a system's output on present and past inputs. The dependence arises because the history affects the value of an internal state. The implemented hysteresis function looks like : (c - 1)^(x - 1) / c^x
member.param: Coefficient parameter of the hysteresis
Input value to be computed

member.name: M:BlueQuark.Utils.Hysteresis(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Computes the hysteresis value (delay effect).
member.remarks: Hysteresis is the time-based dependence of a system's output on present and past inputs. The dependence arises because the history affects the value of an internal state. The implemented hysteresis function looks like : (c - 1)^(x - 1) / c^x
member.param: Coefficient parameter of the hysteresis
Input value to be computed

member.summary: Computes the sigmoid function centered on iCenter of the iValue.
member.remarks: The centered sigmoid function looks like : 1 / (1 + exp(-lambda * x - center))
member.param: Parameter of the function. Bigger lambda make smoother activation
The centered value of the function
The input value

member.name: T:BlueQuark.SpeechRecognitionEvent
member.summary: Event type for speech recognition

member.name: F:BlueQuark.SpeechRecognitionEvent.BEGINNING_OF_SPEECH
member.summary: User started to speak.

member.name: F:BlueQuark.SpeechRecognitionEvent.MAYBE_SPEECH
member.summary: Could be the beginning of speech.

member.name: F:BlueQuark.SpeechRecognitionEvent.NO_SPEECH
member.summary: The previously sent MAYBE_SPEECH event did not lead to and actual beginning of speech.

member.name: F:BlueQuark.SpeechRecognitionEvent.TIMEOUT
member.summary: A timeout occured.

member.name: F:BlueQuark.SpeechRecognitionEvent.TRAILING_SILENCE
member.summary: A trailing silence was detected.

member.name: F:BlueQuark.SpeechRecognitionEvent.BAD_SIGNAL_NOISE_RATIO
member.summary: The signal to noise ratio is too low. This event is generated if at the end of an utterance the signal/noise ratio remains below 12dB.

member.name: F:BlueQuark.SpeechRecognitionEvent.OVERLOAD
member.summary: The speech level is too loud.

member.name: F:BlueQuark.SpeechRecognitionEvent.TOO_QUIET
member.summary: The speech level is too weak.

member.name: F:BlueQuark.SpeechRecognitionEvent.NO_SIGNAL
member.summary: No or very low input signal.

member.name: F:BlueQuark.SpeechRecognitionEvent.POOR_MIC
member.summary: This could mean that the microphone or the audio hardware is of poor quality.

member.name: F:BlueQuark.SpeechRecognitionEvent.NO_LEADING_SILENCE
member.summary: The recording apparantly does not start with leading silence. Possibly the speaker started speaking too soon, but because this detection is only energy based, other noise events at the start of the utterance may also trigger this condition.

member.summary: Based on Google Speech API

member.name: F:BlueQuark.SpeechRecognitionMode.OFFLINE_THEN_ONLINE
member.summary: Based on VoCon grammar system. If no result, a Google Speech API request will be sended.
